metadata.title: Tuesday, 10th March, 2015
metadata.session: FOURTH SESSION OF THE ELEVENTH ASSEMBLY

questions.minister: Minister of Community Development, Mother and Child Health
parts: (a)    what the progress on the construction of the following health posts in Mitete District is:
(i)    Chinonwe; (ii)    Mambungo; (iii)    Lutembwe; (iv)    Washishi;
(v)    Lupui; and (vi)    Mbangweta; and
(b)    what the estimated period of completing the construction of the health posts is.
(a)    when Reuben Rural Health Post in Luombwa Ward in Chitambo Parliamentary Constituency will be opened to the public; and
(b)    what has caused the delay in opening the Health Post.

questions.minister: Minister of Agriculture and Livestock when the Government will construct dams for livestock and irrigation farming in the following areas of Magoye Parliamentary Constituency

(b)    Tetebatwa and Mphangwe in Munenga Ward;

questions.minister: Minister of Education, Science, Vocational Training and Early Education
parts: (a)    when construction of Yeta Community School in Kalabo District will be completed;
(b)    whether the project is still within the contract time-frame for completion;
(c)    if not, what the problems are; and
(d)    what measures have been taken to facilitate completion of the project.

questions.minister: Minister of Education, Science, Vocational Training and Early Education
parts: (a)    how many basic schools have been upgraded to secondary schools in Lumezi Parliamentary Constituency;
(b)    of the schools upgraded, how many have had no new infrastructure constructed; and
(c)    why the schools at (b) have no new infrastructure. QUESTIONS FOR WRITTEN ANSWER W41    Mr I Banda (Lumezi) - to ask the Minister of Justice:
(a)    how many people were referred, by the Courts of Law, to medical facilities to determine their mental fitness to appear in court, from 2010 to 2014, year by year; and
(b)    of the people at (a), how many had their cases cause-listed in the same period. W42    Mr Mr I Banda (Lumezi) - to ask the Minister of Justice:
(a)    how many people were detained at the President’s pleasure from 2004 to 2014 year by year; and
(b)    how many people, who were committed to the High Court, were still awaiting trial, as of December, 2014, province by province.
